title: Lewis Capaldi ‘swipes finger to the bone’ and still hasn’t found love on Tinder
text:
Lewis Capaldi ‘swipes finger to the bone’ and still hasn’t found love on Tinder (Picture: Getty Images)

Lewis Capaldi hasn’t shied away from broadcasting the fact he has found himself unlucky in love.

And despite downloading the dating app Tinder, it seems the 23-year-old is yet to land on the perfect match.

When talking to Metro.co.uk ahead of the Q Awards, in London, the star joked that even though he has swiped right until his heart’s content, he’s still living up the single life.

Before heading into the lavish ceremony, we asked how Tinder was going, to which he replied: ‘Tinder is going…’

We feel you, Lewis.

The Someone You Loved hitmaker smirked: ‘I’m swiping my fingers to the bone, and low and behold I’m still a single man. I haven’t found love, no.’

He joked about his plus one at the Q Awards (Picture: Getty Images)

Pointing to his friend who was taking a backseat on the red carpet, the popstar joked about his plus one, adding: ‘I brought my pal from school called Niall, who works at Edinburgh University in recruitment. There’s no relationship.’

Lewis recently flew a fan out to New York after they matched on Tinder, but he insisted it was not a date.

‘That girl won a competition,’ he explained before laughing: ‘It wasn’t a date. I didn’t set up a f***ing competition to find myself a girlfriend.’

You just never know…

Lewis flew two fans out to New York

The lucky fan was a student from Exeter, known as Jimmy, and was chosen as part of a competition marking the singer’s partnership with Tinder.

Since then, he has dished out his tips on the app, where he revealed that Titanic is his icebreaker.

‘This is absolutely crucial. In the Tinder experience, you’re letting this other person speak to you for the first time,’ he said.

The star went on: ‘Titanic. That’s my ice breaker,’ before he advised against using ‘tragedies that killed thousands of people.’

Lewis also insisted Tinder users not to wear sunglasses in their pictures as it just means the other person has no idea what you look like.

As part of his campaign, he’ll be handing out further tickets to his 22 sold-out gigs around the UK. So that only means one thing, start swiping right for Lewis.
